content.body:
> <@yulia:mozilla.org> shu: do we have an alternative facilitator?

I believe I should shadow a facilitator before I volunteer for that role, but if nobody steps up, I will definitely do my best impression. My understanding is that this mostly involves making sure agenda and minutes get captured, in addition to shepherding the meeting.

I’ve sketched an agenda:
1. Overflow from my kick-off on Module Harmony thru the Compartments lens
2. nicolo-ribaudo on Module Harmony thru the lens of Module Blocks’s emerging spec text
3. caridy on minimum-viable first-class Module and ModuleSource

content.body: I believe yulia | Out of Office until July 11th had in mind some important front-matter to get us all on the same page for each other’s hopes and expectations from module harmony, which I think we ought to pursue as early as possible. I can also attempt to facilitate that, though I’m also not confident I can fill Yulia’s shoes.

content.body: I'd like to propose, for an upcoming meeting, a discussion of how we've figured out how a lot of the space factors into three mostly orthogonal proposals (module reflection, module blocks/fragments, and the loader) since I think we made a lot of progress on that in the past couple weeks

content.body: Agreed. I’d also like to focus on how the points of intersection appear to be coherent.

Some of my thinking, chronicled above, has changed over the last couple weeks.

content.body: Since Caridy’s been challenging my assumption that 262 would need to subsume module maps. Nicolò has also been moving in the direction of subsuming module maps. Not sure whether we’ve crossed positions, but that would be funny.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Since Caridy’s been challenging my assumption that 262 would need to subsume module maps. Nicolò has also been moving in the direction of subsuming module maps. Not sure whether we’ve crossed positions, but that would be funny.

content.body: huh, what do you mean by subsuming module maps?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: huh, what do you mean by subsuming module maps?

content.body: And Nicolò also learned this morning that HTML anchors module maps in an unexpected place: on module instances. That’s surprisingly consistent with what Caridy is proposing.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: And Nicolò also learned this morning that HTML anchors module maps in an unexpected place: on module instances. That’s surprisingly consistent with what Caridy is proposing.

content.body: I mean that module maps are currently implied into existence by 262, through host behaviors. There isn’t a [[ModuleMap]], say, on a Realm record. (Qualifier: this is hearsay. I’m not sufficiently intimate with 262 to purport the non-existence of anything within its pages.)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I mean that module maps are currently implied into existence by 262, through host behaviors. There isn’t a [[ModuleMap]], say, on a Realm record. (Qualifier: this is hearsay. I’m not sufficiently intimate with 262 to purport the non-existence of anything within its pages.)

content.body: Caridy’s driving toward a simplification of the compartment proposal that notably omits Compartment. I’m convinced that it’s functionally equivalent, even up to preserving all useful idempotence invariants and compatibility with our hardened JavaScript objectives. Omitting compartments effectively moves all module memoization behavior to a new kind of concrete Module Record, say, Virtual Module Record, which would be reïfied by a `new Module` constructor.

content.body: I have to think about this more, but after I talked with you (Kris) I'm convinced that my direction and how I understood Caridy's direction from you are not inconciliabile
Always assuming that compartments/"reified modules" are exactly as much powerful as hosts
* Always assuming that compartments/"reified modules" are exactly as much powerful as hosts

m.new_content.body: Always assuming that compartments/"reified modules" are exactly as much powerful as hosts

content.body: My opinion is that, to use the name `Module`, it must be exceedingly worthy. That is to say, there must never come a time in the evolution of 262 that we reify an object that is worthier of the title or create a class where this particular kind of module is no more special that the others. I believe it meets that criterion iff it turns out that all specialization of modules going forward is sufficiently addressed with new types of Static Module Record.
